decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Received 07/10/2014:
1037-01-F12 (Mooring Arrangement), Flood Risk Assessment (Ref WFP:1350994284) December 2012, Ecological Note (Ref JPP0723-L-2012-001) 13 December 2012, Operational Management Plan (Ref 1037-01 Lot's Ait OMP) December 2012, Received 17/11/2014:1037-01-010 Rev C (Mooring Plan), Received 24/11/2014:Site Plan - Lots Ait, Lots Ait Planning Statement, Correspondence from Beckett Rankine (Ref T-lr-0635-00-C1-001-j.doc) dated 20 November 2014, Community Flood Plan dated 21 November 2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - There shall be no dredging, digging, levelling or any other alteration of the Thames riverbank or riverbed under or in the vicinity of the site in association with the implementation of this permission or subsequently in association with the approved development.
Condition : 4 - Each mooring shall be provided with a means of access to mains electricity when the development hereby approved is first implemented and permanently retained thereafter.
Condition : 5 - The occupants of the vessels using the moorings hereby approved shall not use generators and no maintenance shall be carried out on a boat while moored at the site.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the first use of any of the hereby approved moorings, an Operational Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall include, but may not be limited to, details of:
 	Management, procedure and administration.
 	Provision of utilities and access and goods delivery arrangements.
 	Nearest car parking facilities and availability.
 	Environmental protection measures, including storage and disposal of refuse, sewage and other effluent.
 	Types of vessels permitted, including restrictions on size, river-worthiness, licensing, up-keep, etc.
 	Life saving equipment.
The residential moorings hereby approved shall be maintained in accordance with the management plan thereafter.

Condition : 7 - No more than nine boats shall be moored at the site. Each shall be moored in accordance with plan 1037-01-010-C. None of the boats shall exceed 5.5 metres in beam. The boats moored at the site shall be restricted to a single level of accommodation with no superstructure exceeding two metres in height.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the first use of any of the hereby approved moorings, a Flood Risk Assessment, using up-to-date information on flood levels shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - Prior to the first use of any of the hereby approved moorings, an Emergency Flood Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall use up-to-date information on flood levels to inform the strategy. The Plan shall include, but may not be limited to:
 	Details for safe refuge arrangements for future residents
 	Details of safe access/egress routes prior to an extreme flood event for future residents
 	Guidance on mooring arrangements to ensure vessels remain safely in place during flood events
The Emergency Flood Plan shall be implemented throughout the lifetime of the hereby approved development.
description: Change of use of boatyard dock moorings to include nine residential boat moorings
